title: Jabal al-Nour
shortDescription: The holiest site in Islam located in Masjid al-Haram.
fullDescription: Jabal al-Nour (Mountain of Light) is a mountain near Makkah famous for housing the Cave of Hira, where Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) received the first revelation of the Qur'an from Angel Jibreel (Gabriel). This event marked the beginning of his prophethood. The mountain holds great spiritual significance and is visited by many Muslims who wish to reflect on this momentous event in Islamic history.

title: Ghar-e-Hira (Cave of Hira)
shortDescription: The holiest site in Islam located in Masjid al-Haram.
fullDescription: Ghar-e-Hira (Cave of Hira) is a small cave located on Jabal al-Nour near Makkah. It is the sacred place where Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) received the first revelation of the Qur'an from Angel Jibreel (Gabriel) during one of his retreats for worship and reflection. This event marks the beginning of his prophethood and holds deep significance in Islam, making it a popular site for spiritual reflection.

title: Ghar al-Thawr (Cave of Thawr)

fullDescription: The Kaaba is the cube-shaped building at the center of Islam's most sacred mosque...

title: Masjid Aisha (RA)t
shortDescription: The holiest site in Islam located in Masjid al-Haram.
fullDescription: The Kaaba is the cube-shaped building at the center of Islam's most sacred mosque.Masjid e Aisha, also known as Masjid at-Tan'eem, is a mosque located about 7 km from the Kaaba in Makkah. It is the place where Aisha (RA), the wife of Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ), entered into Ihram for Umrah. Today, it serves as a Miqat (station for Ihram) for pilgrims residing in or near Makkah who wish to perform Umrah. It is one of the most commonly used locations for entering Ihram due to its proximity.

title: Bay'ah Mosque (Moaque of Allegiance)

title: Hudaibiyah Mosque
shortDescription: The holiest site in Islam located in Masjid al-Haram.
fullDescription: Hudaybiyyah Mosque (Masjid al-Hudaybiyyah) is located near the outskirts of Makkah and marks the site where the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah was signed between Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and the Quraysh tribe in 6 AH. This historic treaty paved the way for peaceful relations and the eventual spread of Islam. Today, the mosque also serves as a Miqat point, where pilgrims can enter into Ihram for performing Umrah.

title: Aisha Al Rajhi Mosque
shortDescription: The holiest site in Islam located in Masjid al-Haram.
fullDescription: The Kaaba is the cube-shaped building at the center of Islam's most sacred mosque...

title: Nimra Mosque
shortDescription: The holiest site in Islam located in Masjid al-Haram.
fullDescription: Masjid Nimrah is a historic mosque located in the plain of Arafat, near Makkah. It is significant because Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) delivered his Farewell Sermon here during his final Hajj. On the Day of Arafah, thousands of pilgrims gather around this mosque to pray and listen to the Khutbah (sermon). Although not all of the mosque lies within the boundary of Arafat, it remains a key landmark during Hajj.
